column4: how can I make the feisty kernel available in edgy? get linux-source package and recompile? get the bin package and install??
don't ask me why I want that, I have a perfectly good reason!
the best way is to dist-upgrade to feisty
but that's out of question until at least an rc release is out.
you could force an install of the feisty kernel but it might bring in other feisty packages and then that might leave a lot of your edgy packages broken
so, what is the BEST way?
no. is this available in edgy?
sorry, that'd be linux-image-2.6.20 .. and no this is not available for edgy .. it's for feisty
I guess the best way would be to get linux-source-2.6.20 and recompile it with the debian or ubuntu magick in edgy?!
or you could download and install the .deb from the repositories :)
i wash my hands of any responsibility for any problems arising due to the install of this eh .. its not supported on edgy and you must be aware of the implications of doing this :)
shouldn't it provide roughly the same kernel api?

the kernel shouldnt be a problem .. its the package dependencies that might be a little tricky tho -- if you try and install this package manually and you dont get any complaints from dpkg, it ought to work quite well
